intro: Anthyllis subsimplex subsp. valentina, commonly known as the Valentina sweet pea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, pink to lilac-colored flowers. The plant features trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
